direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                           1 A vast and sparkling starfield. A pinpoint of LIGHT appears and starts moving toward the camera... a small and distant cylindrical object tumbling end over end, but we can't determine exactly what it is yet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHEATFIELD - DAY                                        2 A vast and undulating sea of wheat. We become aware that there are two HEADS sticking out of the stalks of wheat: two men are standing and looking up at the sky. As we move towards them,  we begin to hear their conversation...and we can see that the two men are SCOTTY and CHEKOV, dressed in civilian clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they stare up at the sky...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (points to sky) There he is -- there, to the South!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (peers upward) What are ye, blind? That's a bird.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                           3 The cylinder tumbling through space is now closer, and we can now see that it is a BOTTLE of some sort, and it is tumbling directly toward the camera...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHEATFIELD- DAY                                         4 As before, Chekov and Scotty staring at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly we hear a double SONIC BOOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shield their eyes against the sun and look up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (concerned) Repelling the Crystalline Trench... rafting down lava flows... orbital skydiving. it's like the man is running a bloody decathlon across the galaxy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: sound) That should be him now. I think he's just crossed the sound barrier.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                           5 The bottle gets CLOSER...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHEATFIELD - DAY                                        6 A man in a high-tech body harness and parachute LANDS in the wheat flat on his back. His body-suit is charred, scorched, wisps of smoke still curling off of it. There are small thrusters attached to his backpack and boots. Scotty and Chekov move to him. The man removes his helmet. Revealing that it is KIRK. He smiles broadly, like a child who has just come off a roller-coaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk starts to pull off his suit, reacts to a sudden pain in his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk waves him away, and continues to remove his harness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Right on target! I jump out over the Arabian Peninsula... and I end up here, right on the dime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, Captain, your precise target area was thirty-five meters... (points) That way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for pointing that out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've warned ye about that back of yours. You should have a doctor take a look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                          6A The tumbling bottle rushes past, and we can now see that it is a CHAMPAGNE BOTTLE - Dom Perignon, 2265. Follow the bottle as it tumbles through space...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHEATFIELD - DAY                                       6B Kirk, Scotty and Chekov as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This strikes a nerve with Kirk -- we see a flash of hesitation and irritation cross his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow I want to make a tri- elliptical jump. That's where you jump out over Northern China, and make three complete orbits before you start re-entry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain. Perhaps you have forgotten that tomorrow is the christening ceremony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going. (beat) Scotty, help me with this chute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, you're not going? We promised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When I retired, I swore I'd never set foot on a starship again, and I meant it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firm) I don't want to hear anymore about it. I'm not going, and that's final.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                           7 The champagne bottle SMASHES onto the bow of a Federation starship(Excelsior class) sitting in its dock in orbit around Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                          7A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the shards of glass from the bottle as they spread over the ship...revealing the name on the hull: U.S.S. ENTERPRISE NCC-1701-B.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large picture window overlooking the starship in its berth. The window is filled with people in Starfleet uniforms, applauding the christening of the ship (but we hear nothing).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACEDOCK OBSERVATION ROOM (VFX-I)                     8A The people are still applauding and we can see that they are looking out over the ship in its berth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-B IN SPACEDOCK (VFX-I)              8B The great ship sits in spacedock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE                                   9 CLOSE ON A SET OF TURBOLIFT DOORS as they slide open to reveal Kirk, Scotty and Chekov. A bright light shines into their faces and they react. MOVE TO REVEAL - that the bright light is coming from a futuristic
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with a small bank of lights attached to it. The camera is a holographic recorder with two lenses and is worn on an operator's head. There are four JOURNALISTS clustered in front of the Turbolift -- one associated with the camera, the others using PADDS to make notations. Also clustered around the door are the BRIDGE CREW of the Enterprise-B. Everyone is APPLAUDING as Kirk and the others blink under the bright lights and ENTER the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The journalists edge away, and the cameraman moves to get a good angle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman is young, confident, eager -- this is his first command and he takes it very seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The original Enterprise officers all stop and give him a look. Harriman looks a little embarrassed -- he didn't mean to insult them. But Kirk gives him a little smile, lets it roll off. KIRK Well... may we have a look around?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chekov sees someone in the background, calls out to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chekov moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Journalist has unknowingly touched a nerve. Kirk's eyes flash for a moment -- the longer he's on this Bridge, the more he realizes he doesn't feel good about it at all. He tries to shrug it off with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to move away from the Journalist, who dogs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this point, Chekov approaches with a young, (mid- twenties) attractive, Asian female Ensign named DEMORA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk is shocked. For a long moment, he stares at her in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chekov holds out his hand and indicates a very short height.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demora and Chekov move off and Kirk looks after them for a long beat. The expression on his face changes from shock to sadness... Something is clearly bothering him. Scotty moves over to Kirk, with a smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Kirk's mind is still on Demora. He watches her as she moves to the Helmsman's position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk nods absently. Scotty realizes something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman interrupts.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (overlapping) Captain Kirk, how does it feel to be back on the Enterprise Bridge... Captain, can I have a Minute... Captain Scott, do you have any comment on... Commander Chekov... etc.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me, excuse me...there will be plenty of time for questions later...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing, to all) I'm Captain John Harriman. I'd like to welcome you all aboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's our pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just want you to know how excited we all are to have a group of living legends with us on our maiden voyage. (beat) I remember reading about your missions when I was in grade school.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please... please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Demora!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breezy) So, Captain... this is the first Starship Enterprise in thirty years without James T. Kirk in command. How do you feel about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just fine. I'm glad to be here to send her on her way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have you been doing since you retired?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been... keeping busy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Kirk) Excuse me, Captain. I'd like you to meet the Helmsman of the Enterprise-B. Ensign Demora Sulu -- Captain James Kirk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a pleasure to meet you, sir. My father's told me some... interesting stories about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your father... Hikaru Sulu is your father?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You met her once before, but she was...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But that wasn't so long ago... it couldn't have been more than...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twelve years, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... well... congratulations, Ensign. It wouldn't be the Enterprise without a Sulu at the helm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, sir. (to Chekov) Let me show you the new inertial guidance system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Kirk) Damn fine ship if you ask me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Scotty... it amazes me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what would that be, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sulu. When did he find the time for a family?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's like you always said -- if something's important enough, you make the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So... that's why you've been running around the galaxy like an eighteen-year-old. Finding retirement a little lonely, are we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With that kind of tact, I'm glad you're an engineer and not a psychiatrist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me, gentlemen... if you'll take your seats.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 10 Revealing that three CHAIRS have been neatly arranged to one side. Scotty, Kirk and Chekov all take their seats. The Journalists take positions on the opposite side of the Bridge. Harriman moves to the command chair and the rest of the Bridge crew go to their stations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All eyes on Kirk -- he has little choice. He stands uncomfortably. There is a moment of anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone breaks into APPLAUSE. Kirk sits down in acute embarrassment and  annoyance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to all) Prepare to leave spacedock. Aft thrusters ahead one quarter, port and starboard at station keeping. (beat) Captain Kirk, I'd be honored if you would give the order to get underway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no. Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, I insist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to all) Take us out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Very good, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Brought a tear to my eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- ENTERPRISE-B (VFX-I)                            11 The great ship majestically LEAVES the dock, and heads out into open space, passing DIRECTLY OVERHEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE                                  12 A short time later. Harriman turns to his guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the communications console starts to BEEP. The COM OFFICER hits a few commands in response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This grabs everyone's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the voice of a crewmember who sounds panicked and urgent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The voice is drowned out by STATIC. The SCIENCE OFFICER checks something on his console. The Journalist with the Holo-camera turns on his light and pans it around to capture the action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman blinks a couple of times, surprised at this unexpected turn of  events. Kirk watches him intently. Harriman clears his throat, then turns to Demora.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The NAVIGATOR checks his console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Holo-camera light is shined on Harriman as he shifts in his seat, hesitant to take the plunge. Kirk is drumming his fingers impatiently on his leg. Finally, Harriman takes a breath and straightens his jacket a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk fidgets in his chair, itching to get in on the action - his instincts taking over. Scotty shoots him a side-long glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well... we've just cleared the asteroid belt. Our course will take us out beyond Pluto and then back to spacedock. Just a quick run around the block. (beat) If we have time, we'll conduct a few tests of the warp --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Harriman) We're picking up a distress call, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On speakers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fritzed) This is the transport ship Lakul. We're caught in some kind of energy distortion. We can't break free... need immediate help... It' tearing us --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Lakul is one of two ships transporting El-Aurian refugees to Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you locate them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ships are bearing at three one zero mark two one five. Distance: Three light years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Signal the closest starship. We're in no condition to mount a rescue... We don't even have a full crew aboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're the only one in range, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, then... I guess it's up to us. (to Demora) Helm, lay in an intercept course and engage at maximum warp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there something wrong with your chair, Captain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-B (VFX-I)                           13 The ship snaps into warp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE                                  14 A few minutes later. Demora is watching her console.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're within visual range of the energy distortion, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On screen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 15 Which now shows a HUGE RIBBON OF CRACKLING ENERGY directly ahead of the Enterprise-B. Everyone reacts to the bizarre sight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off console) I've found the transport ships.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 15A The Viewscreen now shows TWO TRANSPORT SHIPS trapped like insects in the violent torrent of energy. The ships are being buffeted and thrown about by large TENDRILS of CRACKLING ENERGY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship suddenly SHAKES. The Navigator works his console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman frowns at the screen, trying to figure out what to do. Kirk can barely contain himself -- to him the answer is obvious. He blurts out the answer -- KIRK Tractor beam... Scotty quickly elbows him in the side -- this isn't Kirk's ship. Kirk shuts up.  Harriman glances at Kirk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Kirk hears this order, he shakes his head slightly and mouths the word "no" under his breath. He knows that won't work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman frowns again, trying to come up with another solution, but it isn't easy -- it's his first day in command; his ship is under-manned and ill-prepared. It's a nightmare come true. Kirk is itching to get in On this, his fingers digging into the arms of his chair -- but he restrains himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tense beat. Harriman glances over at the journalists, then glances over at Kirk. Kirk gives him a pained smile, trying to be encouraging even though he knows this is not the right course of action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 15B   INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN (VFX-I)                                 15B Suddenly the right-hand ship on the screen is engulfed by a fiery TENDRIL of energy and it EXPLODES. The other ship continues to be thrown about and buffeted. Everyone reacts with shock on the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman pales at the sight... seems shell-shocked by the destruction of the ship. He's overwhelmed now, at a genuine loss as to what to do next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman looks over at Kirk, who has remained quiet during this entire sequence only through great effort and out of deference to the young Captain. This is a delicate moment -- Harriman doesn't want to look incapable, but at the same time, he needs help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk is out of his chair like a cork out of a bottle. He moves down to stand next to Harriman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman looks at him with surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk gives him a supportive look. Harriman buckles down and grimly looks at the image on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk glances at the Cameraman, who's still shining the light on them  all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cameraman turns OFF the light.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Their hulls are starting to buckle under the stress -- they won't survive much longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're encountering severe gravimetric distortions from the energy ribbon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll have to keep our distance... we don't want to get pulled in too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't have a tractor beam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You left spacedock without a tractor beam?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It won't be installed until Tuesday. (beat) Ensign Sulu... try generating a subspace field around the ships. That might break them free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; shakes her head) There's too much quantum interference, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about... venting plasma from the warp nacelles? That might disrupt the ribbon's hold on the ships.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.. releasing drive plasma...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) It's not having any effect, sir. I think -- DEMORA Sir! The starboard vessel's hull is collapsing --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many people were aboard that ship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two hundred sixty-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent) The Lakul's hull integrity is down to twelve percent, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Kirk... I would appreciate any... suggestions you might have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) First -- move us within transporter range and beam those people to the Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about the gravimetric distortions? They'll tear us apart...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) Risk is part of the game if you want to sit in that chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helm, close to within transporter range.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And second -- turn that damned thing off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-B (VFX-I)                           16 The ship edges in yet closer to the crackling ribbon. The tendrils from the ribbon lash out at the ship, just missing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE                                  17 As before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chekov turns to the two journalists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chekov and the journalists EXIT to the turbolift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The LIEUTENANT is having problems at the aft console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk turns to Scotty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scotty quickly moves to look at the Transporter console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk moves to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scotty begins to work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're within range, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to lieutenant) Beam them directly to Sickbay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (concerned) How big's your medical staff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed) The medical staff... doesn't arrive until Tuesday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You and you. You've just become nurses. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Main Engineering reports fluctuations in the warp plasma relays.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By-pass the relays and go to auxiliary systems.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I'm having trouble locking onto them. They appear to be... in some sort of... temporal flux.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scotty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Their life signs are... are phasing in and out of our space-time continuum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phasing? To where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir! Their hull's collapsing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- THE LAKUL (VFX-I)                               18 The ship is destroyed by an energy tendril.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE                                  19 All eyes on Scotty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the ship is rocked violently. KLAXONS and alarms start to wail and the lights FLICKER on and off. BULKHEAD EXPLODES, sending metal fragments screaming across the Bridge and KILLING the Navigator. Scotty quickly takes over the dead man's console.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I got forty-seven of them... (beat, grim) ... out of one hundred fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Report!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're caught in a gravimetric field emanating from the trailing edge of the ribbon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All engines, full reverse!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- ENTERPRISE-B & RIBBON (VFX-I)                   20 The ship is turning sideways into the WAKE of the ribbon, but cannot break away. It is clearly being pulled along, out of control. Tendrils leap up from the ribbon, lashing against the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B- SICKBAY                                  21 The room is filled with the SURVIVORS of the Lakul. They are all members of the EL-AURIAAN  race -- humanoid and dressed in distinctive clothing. The survivors are in various states of shock. Many sit on the floor, staring into middle distance. some lie on tables, unconscious. others are mumbling incoherently to themselves. Chekov and the Journalists are moving from person to person trying to get control of the situation as the ship is ROCKED and FLUNG about. Chekov has a tricorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at the tricorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One Journalist moves past a man sitting on a bio-bed with a dazed look on his face. He has a nasty-looking wound on one side of his face. (We will later learn that this man is named DOCTOR SORAN.) The journalist is about to turn away when suddenly Soran GRABS him roughly -- clearly a man of great Strength -- and pulls him close. Soran's eyes are suddenly wild, crazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran begins to attack the journalist, but before he can do any real damage, Chekov injects Soran with a hypospray and Soran falls unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly a WOMAN with her back toward us stumbles nearby. Chekov quickly grabs her arm and catches her before she falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman turns around and we see her face for the first time -- it's GUINAN. She seems dazed and confused. Chekov smiles at her warmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he guides Guinan onto a table...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (incoherent, overlapping) The colors are touching me... I'm caught in the glass... Help me... I can see the seconds... Over here... etc
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It will be all right. We're going to take care of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off tricorder) Only minor injuries so far... (beat) But it looks like they're all suffering from some kind of neural shock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why...why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right... you're safe... you're on the Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I have to go... I have to get back... You don't understand! Let me go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was he talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's going to be okay. Here, just lie down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - BRIDGE (VFX-I)                          22 Energy ribbon on viewscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman is gripping the arms of his chair with one hand. His face pales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk tries to buck up the young captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk looks at Scotty expectantly for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demora turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk glances at Harriman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman nods, a little embarrassed. The SHAKING gets worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman heads for the turbolift, and there is a moment as Kirk is sorely tempted to take command of the ship and sit in the Captain's chair one more time. But he pulls himself back before Harriman can exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman nods in acknowledgement. Kirk heads for the turbolift.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Engines not responding!

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) The first thing you learn as Captain is how to cheat death. (beat, then louder) Scotty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (outraged) There's just no way to disrupt a gravimetric field of this magnitude!

dialogue.raw_text: Hull integrity failing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) But I do have a theory...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you might.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're clear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited, to com) You did it, Kirk! (to Demora) Damage report, Ensign.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off console) There's some buckling on the starboard nacelle... (reacts) We've also got a hull breach in the Engineering section. Emergency forcefields are in place and holding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sections twenty through twenty- eight on decks thirteen... fourteen... (looks at Scotty with meaning) ... and fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to com) Bridge to Captain Kirk. (beat) Captain Kirk, please respond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing, to Demora) Have Chekov meet me on deck fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B - CORRIDOR                                34 Scotty and Harriman head down the Corridor. They round a bend... and then stop short. They react to something ahead of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 35 Revealing that the corridor ahead of them is GONE. A jagged hole has been ripped in the ship and OPEN SPACE can be seen beyond the twisted metal. A FORCEFIELD flickers on and off, holding the vacuum of space at bay. Scotty and Harriman look at the awesome sight for a moment. Chekov comes running up the Corridor behind them. He stops and reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long silent beat as Scotty looks out into space.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My God... (beat) Was anyone in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-B (VFX-I)                           36 A huge chunk has been ripped out of the Engineering section, looking like an open wound. Scotty, Chekov, and Harriman can be seen standing inside the small Corridor, looking out into space...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE-B- BRIDGE                                   37 A short time later. Scotty, Harriman and Chekov are listening to Demora, who is working the Helm console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A silent moment. Chekov looks to Scotty, hoping to hear some sort of miracle. Scotty takes a moment looks at the empty command chair. Then he shakes his head. A long beat as everyone is forced to accept this terrible truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman finally breaks the stillness of the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harriman steps down to the Captain's chair and takes command of his ship. Scotty and Chekov exchange a final look. Off the reactions of these two friends who've just lost someone very dear to them both...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've checked the entire ship and the surrounding space. there's no sign of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quiet) Just a quick... run around the block.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never thought it would end like this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All things must end, Mr. Chekov.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-B (VFX-I)                           38 The crippled ship turns and heads away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : SEVENTY-EIGHT YEARS LATER... 39   CLOSE ON A HALYARD                                          39 as a FLAG is quickly hoisted to the top of a mast. The flag reaches the top and is then caught by the wind -- the blue and white banner of the United Federation of Planets waves in the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nineteenth-century three-masted sailing vessel (about the size of a frigate) is hove-to and sitting in the water gently rocking. Across the stern of the ship, we can see the name ENTERPRISE picked out in gold letters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . SAILING VESSEL - DAY                                   40
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: MOVE TO REVEAL THE LOCATION 40 EXT

direction.raw_text: Where PICARD and RIKER are standing before the assembled crew of the ship. Everyone is dressed in full-dress naval uniforms of the period, complete with cocked hats, epaulettes, etc. The crew is standing at attention... the wind whistles through the rigging... the timbers creak... Picard grimly looks over his crew... then finally  he nods to Riker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A drummer begins a long DRUM ROLL.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bring out the prisoner!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as WORF is brought on deck by TROI and GEORDI. Worf is shackled by hand and leg irons. Troi and Geordi hold him by either arm and shove him toward the Captain. The drum roll STOPS. Picard moves to Worf and peers at him closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf doesn't answer and Troi jabs him in the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks to Riker, who then pulls out a large, rolled piece of parchment. He opens the scroll and begins to read from it. In the b.g. Geordi removes Worf's shackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker puts away the scroll
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone ROARS in APPROVAL. Picard smiles at Worf and shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard continues to smile at him for a moment...then Riker steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf's face registers surprise as everyone GRABS HIM and hauls him toward the side, where a long plank is being pushed out over the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard gives Riker a questioning look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard shrugs it off... it's not exactly his cup of tea, but he'll go along with it. Worf is hustled to the rail where BEVERLY is waiting patiently by the plank, holding a long PIKE. Worf is put on the plank and Crusher prods him with the pike until Worf is nearly at the end. Worf finally stops and turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone falls silent a moment. Worf looks over the side at the water below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beverly prods him with the pike and Worf FALLS INTO THE SEA  with a huge SPLASH . Everyone LAUGHS and CHEERS. Reveal DATA, who is standing near the side rail, looking a little confused at the reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data thinks a moment, then he LIFTS Beverly with one hand and hold her over the rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data lets go and Beverly PLUMMETS into the ocean. Data looks around -- no one is laughing. They all look a little surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data is puzzled by the reaction of the crowd... he's more confused than ever.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mister Worf... I always knew this day would come. Are you prepared to face the charges?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am prepared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "We, the officers and crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise, being of sound mind and judgment, hereby make the following charges against Lieutenant Worf: One. That he did knowingly and willfully perform above and beyond the call of duty on countless occasions. Two. That he has been a good and solid officer on this ship for one score less twelve years. And Three. Most seriously... that he has earned the respect and admiration of the entire crew."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There can be only one punishment for such crimes... (beat) I hereby promote you to the rank of Lieutenant Commander, with all the rights and privileges thereto. And may God have mercy on your soul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Congratulations, Commander.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Thank you, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Extend the plank!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Into the sea with him... feed him to the sharks... walk the plank... etc.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you think you're taking this a little too far, Number One?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When we went to ancient Rome for Deanna's promotion, we threw her to the lions, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a shout)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a little embarrassed) I can't swim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the sharks are quite convincing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Beverly) Doctor, I must confess I am uncertain as to why pushing someone into freezing, shark- infested water is amusing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all done in good fun, Data. Get in the spirit of things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data...Data -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data. that wasn't funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: are standing on the quarterdeck as a very wet Beverly comes up on deck.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, now that we're all aboard... (beat, then smiles) Number One, bring the ship before the wind. (savoring the moment) Let's see what's out there.

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, aye, sir. (to Troi) Take the wheel, Commander.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) All hands make sail! Raise up tacks and stand by the braces!

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 46A A U-shaped ARCH with several computer panels visible appears on the forecastle. It's a strange sight to see a piece of the 24th century on the deck of this ship. Picard goes to the arch and activates one of the monitors and waits for the transmission to appear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whose attention has been drawn to Picard, at the arch. She reacts with concern at the expression on his face.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quiet) Captain, are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE-D (VFX-I)                           50 The great ship at impulse. We FOLLOW it and then see ahead of the ship, a small SOLAR OBSERVATORY with a complex optical array. The observatory bears scorch marks and other signs of recent battle. (In the b.g. a YELLOW SUN can be seen.)
direction.name: direction

Riker, Troi, Worf and Data at their stations They didn't have time to change, so they are all still dressed in their costumes from the ceremony. The ship is at Red Alert. The image of the burnt-out observatory is on the VIEWSCREEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grim beat. Picard gets up and starts heading for the Ready Room - his attitude is dismissive, almost irritated that this has interrupted some deeper concern of his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi and Riker exchange a surprised look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard EXITS. An awkward beat. What's wrong with the Captain? But they have their orders. As Riker and  Worf head for the EXIT...

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like we're too late...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off console) There are no other ships in the system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sensors show five life signs aboard the station, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The station complement was nineteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Secure from Red Alert. Number One, begin an investigation. I'll be in my Ready Room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hard) Make it so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY - OPS CENTER (VFX-P)                       52 The station is a SMOKING RUIN -- consoles flickering, lights dim, damage everywhere. Only a few minutes have passed since they were attacked. Riker, Worf, Beverly and two SECURITY GUARDS MATERIALIZE. They're all back in uniform, holding phasers and palm beacons. Worf has a tricorder and Beverly has a medical kit. The room is cramped, there are fallen bulk-heads and blown-out consoles. The debris makes it difficult to get a clear view of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beverly follows her tricorder readings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pick their way carefully through the carnage of the station...and come to the body of a Starfleet Science Officer. He has taken a disruptor blast to the back and there is a nasty-looking scorch mark on his uniform. Beverly immediately takes some devices out of her medical kit and begins to treat him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Security Guards climb a nearby ladder while Riker and Worf head down a dimly-lit corridor. Riker stops at two bodies in the hall, checks them over -- but they're dead. There is a sudden banging from the far corner of the room. Worf and Riker quickly move to a collapsed bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both grab hold of a large metal plate, pull it aside and begin to dig through the debris. Finally, a HAND can be seen grasping about from within the pile of rubble. Riker and Worf work faster. Worf grabs the man's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf holds the man's hand as Riker shoves away a final console. We reveal the head and torso of Doctor Soran, one of the survivors from the Lakul (and last seen in Sickbay aboard the Enterprise-B). Soran has not aged at all over the years but he does have a permanent scar on his face from the earlier wound. He blinks a few times, seems a little dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran puts a hand to his head, still trying to get his bearings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker and Worf move to the ladder as Beverly begins to scan Soran...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These blast patterns are consistent with type-three disruptors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that narrows it to Klingon, Breen or Romulan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm picking up life signs... about twenty meters ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That rules out Klingons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They would not have left anyone alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worf, you're with me. Paskall, you and Mendez search the upper deck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Under here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right... do not struggle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Commander William Riker of the Starship Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Soran... Doctor Tolian Soran...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who attacked you, Doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure... it happened so fast...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls out) Commander -- you'd better take a look at this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Riker and Worf move over to the two Security Guards who are kneeling over a dead body which is obscured from view. One guard turns over the body, revealing a ROMULAN SOLDIER. Worf looks at him in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker and Worf exchange a look. OFF their reactions...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Romulan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data frowns. troubled by this recent experience. He puts Spot down and moves to a bulkhead. He activates a control panel and a small compartment slides OPEN, revealing a small COMPUTER CHIP  which is suspended in a glass and metal framework. Data looks at the chip for a beat and Geordi moves to him in concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi considers a moment, looks at the chip... and reluctantly has to agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data sits down and La Forge moves to stand behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi works on Data's head for a moment, and then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a panel on Data's head, revealing the blinking circuitry within.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is she still angry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... but I'd stay out of Sickbay for a while if I were you. I still don't know why you dropped her in the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was attempting to... get in the spirit of things. I thought it would be humorous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data... you're not thinking about using that thing are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It has occurred to me on several occasions. But I believe this may be the appropriate time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute. I thought you've always been afraid it would overload your neural net.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is true. However, I believe my growth as an artificial life form has reached an impasse. For thirty-four years I have endeavored to become more "human" - to grow beyond my original programming. And yet I am still unable to grasp such a simple concept as humor. (re: chip) This emotion chip is the only answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But at the first sign of trouble, I'm going to deactivate it. agreed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agreed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . READY ROOM                                             55 Riker is standing next to Picard, who has his back turned and is staring out the window. Picard seems distracted during the scene, his mind clearly elsewhere as Riker finishes his report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard nods absently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard keeps his back turned, looking out the window. Riker hesitates, awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat, then Riker turns and EXITS. Off Picard's unreadable face...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We found two dead Romulans aboard the station. We're analyzing their equipment to see if we can determine what ship they came from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's still no indication of why they attacked the station?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We think they were looking for something -- they practically tore the place apart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmm... (beat) Inform Starfleet Command. This could indicate a new Romulan threat in this sector.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want me to contact Starfleet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Number One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is something else, Captain. One of the scientists. a Doctor Soran... has insisted on speaking with you. (beat) I told him you were busy, sir, but he said it was absolutely imperative that he speak with you right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Understood. That will be all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir... is there anything wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TEN FORWARD                                            56 The room is bustling with patrons and activity. Data ENTERS with an odd look on his face...his body language subtly altered. He is looking at the world through new eyes. Geordi is following him closely, watching his every move. They move to the bar. Guinan comes over -- she has not aged at all since the Enterprise-B. She sets down an exotic-looking container full of dark liquid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pours two glasses of the liquid. Data takes one and sniffs it, then takes a drink. Geordi watches him closely. Data frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data finishes the drink... concentrates, tries to make sense of the rush of feelings. His expression is one of disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data looks at Geordi with a big smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g., we see Picard ENTER Ten Forward.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You two just volunteered to be my first victims. (re: liquid) This is a new concoction I picked up on Forcas Three. Trust me, you're going to love it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe the beverage has provoked an emotional response.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? What do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am uncertain. I have had little experience with emotions... I am unable to articulate the sensation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Emotions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll explain later...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Geordi) I don't think he likes it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Yes. That is it. I hate it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, I think the chip is working...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I hate this! It is revolting!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Another round?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he walks through Ten Forward and heads toward a table by the windows. Soran is sitting at the table, staring out at the stars, lost in thought. His observatory uniform is distinctive, and sets him apart from everyone else in the room. Picard walks up to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men shake hands and Picard sits down. Soran is an imposing physical presence, but at the moment he seems very much the eccentric scientists consumed with his work. Picard waves away a waiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard's reaction is a little impatient -- this doesn't sound that imperative to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard moves to stand, but Soran reaches out and gently but firmly grabs him by the arm. The unexpected physical contact and the change of intensity in Soran's face stops Picard in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For some reason, Soran's words have struck a deep chord within Picard. He looks away from Soran's compelling gaze and thinks for a long moment. When he finally speaks, his voice is barely above a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard walks away without a word before Soran can thank him. Soran looks after him with relief, then pulls out an ANTIQUE POCKET WATCH and opens it. He looks at the watch for a long moment. then snaps it closed and head for the opposite exit from the one Picard took. FOLLOW Soran across Ten Forward...until he suddenly stops in shock at something he sees...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor Soran...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, yes, Captain -- thank you for coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing for me. (brusque, to Soran) I understand there's something urgent you need to discuss with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I need to return to the observatory immediately. I must continue a critical experiment I was running on the Amargosa star.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor... we're still conducting an investigation into the attack. Once we've completed our work, we'll be happy to allow you and your fellow scientists back aboard the observatory. Until then -- SORAN The timing is very important on my experiment -- if it is not completed within the next twelve hours, years of research will be lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're doing the best we can. Now if you'll excuse me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cryptically) They say time is the fire in which we burn... and right now, Captain, my time is running out. (beat) We leave so many things unfinished in our lives -- I'm sure you can understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see what I can do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 58 of Guinan, who is now back at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dark look crosses his face -- he is disturbed by the sight of Guinan. He quickly turns and EXITS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: she begins to sense something, as though someone is watching her. She turns, looks in the direction where Soran was just standing, but there's no one there now. She shakes off the feeling and goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENGINEERING                                            61 A short time later. A Romulan tricorder is connected to some diagnostic equipment near a console. Worf is talking to Riker. Worf activates a MONITOR which shows a complex diagram of sensor information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker considers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: One of the dead Romulans had a tricorder. We analyzed its sensor logs and found they were scanning for signature particles of a compound called trilithium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trilithium?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An experimental compound the Romulans have been working on. In theory, a trilithium-based explosive would be thousands of times more powerful than an anti-matter weapon. But they never found a way to stabilize it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why were they looking for it on a Federation observatory? It doesn't make any sense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Have Geordi and Data go over with the next Away Team...  tell them to scan the observatory for trilithium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY OPS                                        62 The station is still a wreck. Geordi and Data are scanning the room with tricorders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi continues to scan... then suddenly Data lets out a quiet GIGGLE. Geordi stops and turns to look at him. Data giggles louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data laughs again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi looks blankly at him for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi indicates a corridor. They EXIT in that direction...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (off tricorder) There's no sign of any trilithium in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing, to himself) I get it. I get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You get what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When you said to Commander Riker... (imitating Geordi's voice) "The clown can stay, but the Ferengi in the gorilla suit has to go."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: During the Farpoint mission. We were on the Bridge and you told a joke. That was the punch line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Farpoint mission? Data, that was seven years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. I just got it. (laughs) It was very funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY CORRIDOR - CONTINUOUS                      63 A short corridor connecting the Ops Center with other compartments. Geordi suddenly stops in front of what appears to be a standard bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi runs his finger in a vertical line along what appears to be a smooth bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi puts his tricorder away and begins looking for a way to open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data steps forward and OPENS a small panel on wrist and makes a quick adjustment to the circuitry within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data completes his adjustment and then moves his wrist over the door panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a HUMMING sound followed by a loud CLICK. The door slides open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi reacts to the bad pun with a grimace. They EXIT to.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute... there's a hidden doorway here. I can see the joint of the metal with my VISOR.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off tricorder) There appears to be a dampening field in operation. I cannot scan beyond the bulkhead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't see a control panel...or an access port.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off tricorder) It appears to be a magnetically sealed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe I can reverse the polarity by attenuating my axial servo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joking) "Open sesame."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) You could say I have a... magnetic personality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY PROBE ROOM - CONTINUOUS                    64 A small room with several probes stacked in holding racks. Geordi and Data scan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They put their tricorders away and begin looking around the room. Data continues to snicker and giggle as he tries not to laugh at jokes his mind conjures up. Geordi begins inspecting the probes... finally stops at one probe which has SEVERAL ODD DEVICES attached to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data uses the tricorder as if it were a puppet as he opens and closes it like a mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data giggles and Geordi reacts with the irritation of someone listening to a very bad comedian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data helps Geordi as they try to open a panel on the casing of the probe. They open the panel and Geordi looks inside.he reacts to something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data suddenly start LAUGHING. Geordi turns in irritation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm still not picking up anything. Someone went to a lot of trouble to shield this room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, take a look at this. (Data comes over) You ever seen a solar probe with this kind of configuration?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (making tricorder "talk") No, Geordi. I have not. It is most unusual.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just help me get this panel open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa. my VISOR'S picking up something in the theta band...it could be a trilithium signature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, this isn't the time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) I am sorry... but I cannot stop myself... I think something is wrong...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 64A Data's laughter escalates into hysteria... then Data begins to JERK and SHAKE and goes into a bizarre "emotional seizure." A rush of EMOTIONS race across his face. anger, passion, shock... a kaleidoscopic blur of reactions contort his features. Then it stops and he FALLS to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi rushes to him. Data has a look of surprise on his face as he blinks a few times. He sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no response. Geordi frowns for a beat, then we hear Soran's voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Data!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe the emotional chip has overloaded my positronic relays.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We better get you back to the Ship. (hits combadge) La Forge to Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a problem, gentlemen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: standing in the room. Geordi didn't hear him come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over the above dialogue, Soran glances over at the solar probe Geordi was inspecting. He notes the opened panel and a disturbed look crosses his face. Soran looks back at Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran moves toward them. and then without warning, he punches Geordi in the face, KNOCKING the VISOR across the room. He whirls around and points a phaser at Data, who suddenly looks fearful.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... Doctor... yeah, as a matter of fact, there is. There's a damping field in here blocking our com signal. (re: Data) Will you give me a hand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd be happy to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please don't hurt me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PICARD'S QUARTERS                                      66 Picard is standing at the replicator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cup of tea APPEARS in the replicator and at the same moment, the door CHIMES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi ENTERS. Picard would rather not be bothered right now, but he is polite as always.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Troi won't be brushed away so easily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard is really not in the mood for this. His tone hardens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi takes a seat and patiently waits. Picard gets up.moves around the room for a moment...and stops. He speaks in a flat, unemotional tone of voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi reacts, genuinely surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He trails off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi eyes an open photo album on the table. She reaches over and flips through the pages for a moment. There are many photos inside... from many periods in time including one of Picard's brother standing next to his young son. This is the Picard family album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard hesitates -- this is difficult for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard moves to the window, stares outside. A shadow crosses his face. He's getting to the heart of the matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard moves back to the photo album, open it to the last page, an then flips through the remaining pages -- they are blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quiet beat as Troi considers him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, a BLINDING BURST OF LIGHT  from outside the windows washes into the room. Troi and Picard rush to the window and shield their eyes against the glare.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tea. Earl Grey. Hot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Counselor. What can I do for you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually... I'm here to see if there's anything I can do for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... I appreciate your concern, but I'd rather not discuss it right now, thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I can't just leave it at that. The commanding officer of this ship is clearly distraught about something. As ship's Counselor, it's my duty to -- PICARD As ship's counselor, it's your duty to know not only when you're needed... but also when you're not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't fool an empath, Captain. I know exactly when I'm needed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, with all due respect to your Betazoid senses, I prefer to be alone right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well. I suppose I could make out my weekly report to Starfleet Command without your input. (beat) "Admiral Lusby... regarding the unusual behavior of Jean-Luc Picard: I find him increasingly Irritable... remote... and uncooperative. I recommend forced shore leave at a Starbase facility in order to --" PICARD All right, all right. You've made your point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The message I received... (beat) My brother... and his son -- my nephew -- burned to death in a fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, I'm sorry. (beat) I know there were a lot of unresolved conflicts between you and your brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I can't get out of my mind is the image of Rene -- my nephew. I just can't believe he's gone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's only natural to feel a heightened sense of tragedy when a child dies... (sensing more) But it goes deeper than that, doesn't it? I can sense that Rene meant a great deal to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a way, he was as close as I ever came to having a child of my own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your family history is very important to you, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Ever since I was a little boy, I remember hearing about the family line. The Picards that fought at Trafalgar... the Picard's that settled the first Martian colony. When my brother married and had a son...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... You felt it was no longer your responsibility to carry on the family line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) My brother had shouldered that burden... allowing me to pursue my own selfish needs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing selfish about pursuing your own life... your own career.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Counselor... I'm not getting any younger. For some time now, I've been aware that there are fewer days ahead than there are behind... (beat) But I always took comfort in the fact that when I was gone, my family would continue. But now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've had brushes with death... more than I care to contemplate. I always accepted it as a calculated risk that goes along with wearing this uniform. (beat) But now... the idea of death has a terrible sense of finality to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm the last Picard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, perhaps we --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Red Alert! All hands to duty stations!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE (VFX-I)                                         69 Picard and Troi ENTER from a turbolift. Riker and Worf at their stations. The star is on the Viewscreen, getting DARKER by the second... more flaming debris is being ejected into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something beeps on Worf's console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks at Riker, who then quickly heads for the turbolift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riker and Worf EXIT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Report.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A quantum implosion has occurred within the Amargosa star. All nuclear fusion is breaking down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is that possible?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sensor records show a solar probe was launched from the observatory a few moments ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The star's going to collapse in a matter of minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, the implosion has produced a level twelve shock wave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) Level twelve? That'll destroy everything in this system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Transporter room to Bridge. I can't locate Commander La Forge or Mister Data, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Worf) Did they return to the ship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (works) No, sir. They are not aboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long until the shock wave hits the observatory?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four minutes, forty seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mister Worf.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- THE STAR (VFX-I)                                70 The star is almost entirely dark. Radiating out from the star is a huge shock wave- a rapidly growing sphere of energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY PROBE ROOM (VFX-P)                         71 Soran is standing at a console watching a graphic depiction of the star's collapse on a monitor when the door suddenly opens. Soran whirls around and FIRES his phaser at Riker and Worf. They dive for cover just outside the room. (NOTE: The probe Geordi examined earlier is now gone.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf dodges another phaser blast and sees Geordi lying unconscious on the deck. Data is nowhere to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran's only answer is another phaser blast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Worf) What the hell's he doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enterprise to Commander Riker, you have two minutes left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yells to Soran) Soran, did you hear that? There's a level twelve shock wave coming. We've got to get out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                 72 As before. ENSIGN HAYES is at Tactical. An ALARM suddenly BEEPS on the Tactical console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shocked reactions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent) Sir. A Klingon Bird of Prey is decloaking off the port bow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE (VFX-I)                                          73 as an old-style Klingon Bird of Prey decloaks near the observatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OBSERVATORY PROBE ROOM (VFX-P)                         74 Soran is continuing to SHOOT at Riker and Worf. Riker suddenly notices something off-camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 74A Data is huddled in a corner of the room, cowering in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 74B The firefight continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data looks up at him with a terrified look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Soran's communicator BEEPS. Soran reaches down and grabs the unconscious Geordi by the collar and the two of them DEMATERIALIZE. (Soran has the VISOR in his hand.) Riker, Data and Worf react.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Data! See if you can get to Geordi!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... cannot, sir. I believe I Am... afraid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)                       75 The Bird of Prey cloaks and vanishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                 76 As before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Transporter room to Bridge. I have the Away Team aboard, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Con) Helm, warp one, engage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE & OBSERVATORY (VFX-I)               77 The Enterprise warps away just as the shock wave reaches the observatory and vaporizes it in a fiery EXPLOSION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - BRIDGE                          78 On a monitor where we can see a graphic depiction of the darkening star and shock wave. MOVE TO REVEAL We are the inside an old Klingon ship - it's beaten up and patched in several places, obviously not a first-line model. Watching the Viewscreen are LURSA and B'ETOR, two powerful-looking Klingon women... They are sisters. aggressive... seductive... and very dangerous. Several N.D. male Klingons man the various stations. The sisters stare at the image of the destroyed sun in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran now ENTERS the Bridge. His expression is dark and angry. He is clearly not a prisoner here and he strides up to the sisters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But without warning, Soran HITS B'Etor squarely in the jaw, knocking her back over a console. Several Klingons leap to their feet, drawing their weapons... but B'Etor holds up a hand as she gets to one knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She dabs a trickle of blood at the corner of her mouth... her expression is angry and threatening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B'Etor has now gotten to her feet in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B'Etor grabs Soran and holds a wicked-looking knife to his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran is unfazed by this threat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lursa reaches out and calmly pushes her sister's knife away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dragging the unconscious Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran moves toward Geordi, a grim look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran EXITS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Toh-pak-cha... (Glorious...)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: HoS qorDu... (A great power...)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited, to Soran) You've done it, Soran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope for your sake that you are initiating a mating ritual.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got careless. The Romulans came looking for their missing trilithium.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Impossible. We left no survivors on their outpost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They knew it was aboard the observatory. If the Enterprise hadn't intervened, they would have found it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But they didn't find it... and now we have a weapon of unlimited power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have the weapon, Lursa. And if you ever want me to give it to you, I advise you to be a little more careful in the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps we are tired of waiting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Without my research... the trilithium is worthless... as are your plans to reconquer the Klingon Empire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Set course for the Veridian system. Maximum warp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Helm) Bosh-ta-JaH Veridian (Set course for Veridian)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What shall I do with this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bring him with me. I need some answers from Mr. La Forge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR                                               80 Riker and Worf are on the move down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They EXIT to...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have spoken to the Klingon High Council, sir. They identified the Bird of Prey as belonging to the Duras sisters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Lursa and B'Etor...? This doesn't make any sense. A renowned stellar physicist somehow uses a trilithium probe to destroy a star, kidnaps Geordi... and escapes with a pair of Klingon renegades... Why? What the hell's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SICKBAY                                                81 Worf and Riker ENTER. Beverly is closing a panel on the back of Data's head. He is sitting on a bio-bed, scanning himself with a tricorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data's expression is still one of concern. Beverly pulls Riker aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beverly activates the wall monitor and a picture of Doctor Soran along with some biographical information appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hits a control and suddenly Guinan's face appears on the screen. Riker reacts to the image...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like a power surge fused the emotional chip into his neural net.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will that be a danger to him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so. The chip still seems to be working. I'd feel better if I could take a closer look, but I can't remove it without completely dismantling his cerebral conduit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Data) Looks like you're stuck with emotions for a while. How do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am quite... preoccupied with concern about Geordi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We all are, Data. But we're going to get him back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope so, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue
