dialogue.raw_text: Wil, I checked into Doctor Soran's background.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's an El-Aurian... over three hundred years old. He lost his entire family when the Borg destroyed his world. Soran escaped with a handful of other refugees aboard a ship called the Lakul. The ship was destroyed by some kind of energy ribbon, but Soran and forty-six others were rescued by the Enterprise-B.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts) That was the mission where James Kirk was killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I checked the passenger manifest of the Lakul... guess who else was on board?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GUINAN'S QUARTERS                                      82 Close on Guinan as she looks up, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan's Quarters, which are unlike any of the others on the Enterprise. None of the standard furniture, consoles or decoration are present. The floor is made of tile, not carpet... the walls are draped in exotic fabric. The lighting is moody and subdued. Picard is standing before Guinan, who is sitting cross- legged on the floor. They talk to each other with an easy familiarity... two old friends who know each other well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan stands and begins to move about the room... she's clearly troubled by the memories. She hesitates, looks off into the middle-distance for a few moments. Picard moves to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan moves to a table and begins to shift around some exotic-looking alien artifacts... distracting herself... this is difficult for her to discuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She makes the decision to plunge ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to him and her face is filled with some kind of awe at the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long beat as Picard absorbs her words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan shows a rare burst of anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan moves to a window and looks out at the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard stops, looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard weighs her words... sees the warning in her eyes... and carefully backs away and EXITS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Soran? That's a name I haven't heard in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you remember him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes. I remember everyone who was on the Lakul... every face. even the ones who didn't make it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan. It's important that you tell me what you know. We think Soran's developed a weapon... a terrible weapon. It might give him enough power to -- GUINAN Soran doesn't care about power or weapons. All he cares about is getting back to the Nexus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the "Nexus"?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a place I've tried very hard to forget...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That ribbon isn't just some random energy phenomenon traveling through space... it's a doorway. It leads to another place... the Nexus. It doesn't exist in our Universe... and it doesn't play by the same rules either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't remember very much... what it looked like or how long I was there... but I do remember how it felt...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was like being inside... joy. As if joy was a real thing that I could wrap around myself. I've never been so content...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But then you were beamed away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was pulled away. I didn't want to leave; none of us did. I felt like I'd left a part of myself behind. All I could think about was getting back... I didn't care what I had to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It took a long time, but eventually I learned to live with it. And I began to realize that my experience in the Nexus had changed me... (beat) I knew things about people... about events...about time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your "sixth sense"... I've always wondered where it came from... (beat) And what about Soran?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Soran may still be obsessed with getting back. And if he is, he'll do anything to find that doorway again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why destroy a star...? (beat) Thank you, Guinan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let someone else do it, Jean-Luc.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let them send another starship. Don't get near the ribbon. If you go into that Nexus, you're not going to care about Soran or the Enterprise or me. All you're going to care about is how it feels to be there. (beat) And you're never going to come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS (VFX-P)                83 A dimly-lit room somewhere in the bowels of the Klingon ship. Like every other room on this decrepit ship, the room looks well-worn and ill-maintained. Soran is seated behind a table, holding the VISOR. A PADD and Soran's pocket watch sit on the table. Geordi is sitting in a chair across from him -- his shirt has been removed. He looks very tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran takes a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran picks up the PADD from the desk and activates it. Suddenly something small, with sharp edges, can be seen MOVING just underneath Geordi's skin near his chest. Geordi moves his hand to the spot, but then the protrusion is suddenly gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the PADD in Soran's hand, we can now see an interior graphic of Geordi's body sitting in the chair. The graphic is interactive, moving as Geordi moves. A BLINKING DOT represents the movement of the probe inside his body. Right now, the dot is in the middle of his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the PADD, we now see the dot has moved to a position next to Geordi's heart. Soran looks up at Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran taps a control on the PADD. Suddenly Geordi grabs his chest in pain. Soran watches Geordi for a few seconds, then taps the PADD again. Geordi gasps and starts to breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran's features soften as he smiles slightly. For a moment, he looks genuinely compassionate -- and it's a disturbing contrast to his usual dark intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran taps a control on the PADD. Geordi gasps and strains against an unimaginable pain. Soran picks up his pocket watch and opens the cover... sits back in his chair, watching the seconds tick away...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (re: VISOR) A remarkable piece of equipment... but a little inelegant, wouldn't you say? (beat) Have you ever considered a prosthesis that would make you look a little more... normal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's normal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Normal is what everyone else is... and what you are not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you may or may not be aware, I am an El-Aurian. Some people call us a race of "listeners". We listen. (beat) Right now, Mr. La Forge, you have my undivided attention. I want to listen to everything you know about trilithium. and me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trilithium is an experimental compound developed by the Romulans. I think it's a derivative of --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want a science lecture. You were on that observatory looking for trilithium... why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was ordered to by the Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's try to move beyond the usual prisoner-interrogator banter, shall we? You have information, and I need it. (beat) Did the Captain explain his orders to you? Did he say why you were searching for trilithium?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about... Guinan? What has she told you about me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan? I don't know what you're talking about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My instincts tell me you're lying. And I know that can't be easy for you... (off PADD) I can see you have a good heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... I forgot to tell you. While you were unconscious, I injected a nano-probe into your bloodstream. It's been navigating your cardiovascular system... and right now I've attached it to your left ventricle. (smiles) A little trick I picked up from the Borg.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gasping) Yeah... they're full of great ideas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just stopped your heart for five seconds. It felt like an eternity, didn't it? Did you know that you can stop the human heart for up to ten minutes before the onset of brain damage?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I didn't know that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We learn something new about ourselves every day. (beat) Now. Maybe I didn't make myself clear. It is very important that you tell me exactly what Captain Picard knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you everything... you might as well just kill me right now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not a killer, Mr. La Forge. (beat) Let's try thirty seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STELLAR CARTOGRAPHY (VFX-P)                            84 A room filled with exotic-looking devices, sensors and computers which handle the enormous task of tracking the ship's position in space. The monitors around the room display various diagrams of the ENERGY RIBBON (as seen in the beginning of the film). Data is sitting at a computer console which has a great deal of complex information on the screen. Picard is standing next to him. Throughout the following, Data seems distracted and preoccupied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data doesn't answer right away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard moves about the room... he's frustrated... tired... but determined to find out what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data works the computer and then the computer begins to work. Data sighs -- his expression becomes downcast and gloomy. He sits down and puts his head in his hands. Picard finally has to say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard regards him sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: According to our information, the ribbon is a conflux of temporal energy which travels through our galaxy every thirty-nine point one years
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When is it expected back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Captain. The Ribbon has already entered the galaxy. It will pass through this sector in approximately thirty-one hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan said Soran was trying to get back to the ribbon... if that's true, then there must be some connection with the Amargosa star.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The star's destruction has had numerous astro-physical effects within this sector. However, none of them appear to have a connection to the energy ribbon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a list of those effects. I want to know every single thing which has been altered or changed... no matter how insignificant...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It will take a few moments for the computer to compile the information.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir. I am finding it difficult to concentrate... I believe I am overwhelmed with feelings of... remorse and regret concerning my actions on the observatory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanted to save Geordi... I tried. but I experienced something I did not expect. (beat) I believe it was fear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fear is a very difficult emotion to overcome. It's something we all have to learn to deal with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I did not deal with it, sir. I let it prevent me from helping my friend. (beat) Does that make me a coward?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. And what you must try to avoid is becoming consumed by another emotion which I believe you're beginning to experience... guilt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (considers) Guilt. It is a most unpleasant feeling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84A The computer finishes its calculations and the console BEEPS. Data works the console. Information appears on screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard is starting to get an idea... he's onto something here. He moves to a large table in the center of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: According to our current information, the destruction of the Amargosa star has had the following effects in this sector: gamma emissions have increased by five percent... the starship Bozeman was forced to make a course correction... a research project on Gorik Four was halted due to increased neutrino particles... ambient magnetic fields have decreased by -- PICARD Wait. The Bozeman... why did it change course?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (matter of fact) The destruction of the Amargosa star has altered the gravitational forces throughout the sector. Any ship passing through this region will have to make a minor course correction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (musing) A minor course correction... (beat) Where is the ribbon now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84B Data moves to the table to work. after a few beats, an elaborate map of the galaxy springs up on the ceiling of the room. A BLINKING DOT shows the position of the ribbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data hesitates... still obsessed with his own emotional turmoil. Picard finally has to lay down the law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This snaps Data back... he considers this for a long moment, then looks  determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is its current position.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you project its course?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firm) Data. I have nothing but sympathy for what you're going through. But right now, I need your full attention on the task at hand. If you can't provide it... then I'll have to relieve you of duty until Doctor Crusher can remove this. emotion chip of yours. I'm sorry, but you leave me no other choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not wish to remove the chip, sir. Although these emotions are proving difficult to deal with... I cannot imagine going back to a life without them. I have taken an important step toward becoming truly human. If I were to turn back now... (beat) I would like to continue in my duties, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Courage is an emotion too, Data. (beat) Now... can you project the course of the ribbon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84C Data works the console. A RED LINE moves to form an arc through the star field. Picard examines the display for a moment and nods... he's excited, on to something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data works and the display now ZOOMS into a single SECTOR. The RED LINE cuts through the sector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data works. A STAR is highlighted near the red line.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Enhance grid A-nine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where was the Amargosa star?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now... you said the gravitational forces in this sector have been altered... could that also affect the course of the ribbon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinks) I believe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84D Data works and holographic display CHANGES again. The red line representing the course of the ribbon now shifts to the right -- AWAY from the Amargosa star's position. Picard is beginning to realize what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data thinks for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard thinks about this... then has a flash of insight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's what Soran's doing... he's changing its course. (beat) But why? Why try to alter its path... why not simply fly into it with a ship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our records show that every ship which has approached the ribbon has either been destroyed or severely damaged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can't go to the ribbon... so he's trying to make the ribbon come to him. (beat) Data, is it going to pass near any M-Class planets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (works) Yes, sir. There are two in the Veridian system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84E The display ZOOMS IN on a star very close to the ribbon's path. We now see a SOLAR SYSTEM with a single star and FOUR PLANETS. The RED LINE moves directly through the system -- it passes very close to the third planet. Picard eyes that planet and points to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard's mind is going a mile a minute. He suddenly has a horrible realization.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's very close to Veridian Three... but not close enough...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data, what would happen to the ribbon's path if he destroyed the Veridian star itself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 84F Data works. On the display, the Veridian star suddenly DARKENS and GOES OUT. The RED LINE shifts slightly until it makes an exact INTERSECTION WITH THE THIRD PLANET. They both react to this sight. they're both aware of just how serious this is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard eyes the graphic with a sense of dread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grim beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard heads for the exit, a sense of urgency and determination in his every move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard and Data EXIT Stellar Cartography.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's where he's going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It should be noted, sir, that the collapse of the Veridian star would produce a shock wave similar to the one we observed at Amargosa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grim) And destroy every planet in the system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are any of them inhabited?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Veridian Three is uninhabited. but Veridian Four supports a pre- industrial humanoid society.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Population?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Approximately two hundred thirty million.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to com) Picard to Bridge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worf here, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Red Alert, Mister Worf. Set a course for the Veridian system, maximum warp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE (VFX-I)                         85 as it goes into warp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - BRIDGE                          86 Lursa and B'Etor in command as Soran ENTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran hands B'Etor a small computer CHIP.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you get anything from the human?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. His heart just isn't in it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off console) We have entered orbit of Veridian Three.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Prepare to transport me to the surface.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait. When do we get our payment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This contains all the information you'll need to build a trilithium weapon. It's been coded. Once I'm safely to the surface, I'll transmit the decryption sequence to you... not before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent) Mistress! -- a Federation starship is entering the system!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? On viewer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 86A The Helm works. The view screen now shows the Enterprise at impulse entering the system. Reactions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Helm works. We hear PICARD'S COM VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran's expression darkens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran thinks for a moment... then  he gets an idea. He pulls Geordi's VISOR out of a pocket. He eyes it with intent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off Lursa and B'Etor's curiosity...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They are hailing us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Du'cha (On speakers.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Klingon vessel. We know what you're doing, and we will destroy any probe launched toward the Veridian star.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do we do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's no time for this. Eliminate them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts) That is a Galaxy class Starship. We are no match for them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it's time we gave Mister La Forge his sight back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE (VFX-I)                         87 nearing Veridian Three. The planet's STAR is visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                 88 Picard is pacing. Riker, Data, Worf, Troi, N.D.s at their stations. The ship is at Red Alert. Data's mood has improved. He's making an effort to keep a positive outlook... to stay upbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data smiles, delighted at the request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Data works, he breaks into a merry little song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf turns to Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They exchange a grim look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An alarm goes off on Worf's console.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe they're not out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're just trying to decide whether a twenty year-old Klingon Bird of Prey is any match for the Federation flagship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or perhaps they're on the surface...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mister Data, scan the planet for life forms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was hoping you would ask me to do that, Captain. I just love to scan for life forms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sings) "Life forms... tiny little life forms... where are the life forms --" PICARD Commander.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, sir. (works) There is too much interference in the planet's ionosphere for an accurate reading.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, according to my calculations, a solar probe launched from either the Klingon ship or the planet's surface will take eleven seconds to reach the star. (beat) However, since we do not know the exact point of origin, it will take us between eight and fifteen seconds to lock our weapons onto it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quiet, to Picard) That's a pretty big margin of error.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too big. How long until the ribbon arrives?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Approximately forty-seven minutes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disturbed) I have to find a way to get to Soran...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, Klingon vessel decloaking directly ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 88A On the view screen, the Bird of Prey decloaks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They are hailing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On screen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 88B On the view screen, Lursa and B'Etor APPEAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lursa and B'Etor exchange a glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two sisters appear to consider this for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The transmission ENDS. Picard heads for the Turbolift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Picard EXITS...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain. What an unexpected pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lursa, I want to talk to Soran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid the Doctor is no longer aboard our ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I'll beam down to his location. Just give us his coordinates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Doctor values his privacy. He would be quite... upset if an Away Team interrupted him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well... I'll beam to your ship and you can transport me to Soran...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent) Sir, you can't trust them. They'll kill you just like they Killed Geordi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (innocent) We did not kill your Engineer. He's been... our guest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then return him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In exchange for what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me... If you let me speak to Soran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lursa) The Captain would make a much more valuable hostage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Picard) We'll consider it a prisoner exchange.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Agreed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Number One, you have the Bridge. Have Doctor Crusher meet me in Transporter Room Three.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TRANSPORTER ROOM (VFX-P)                               89 Picard stands on the platform. Crusher and NURSE OGAWA stand nearby. The TRANSPORTER CHIEF works his console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard DEMATERIALIZES -- and at the same instant, Geordi MATERIALIZES. Beverly and Ogawa rush to his aide, pull out their tricorders and scan him. Geordi is conscious, and he's wearing his VISOR.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Receiving the coordinates, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Energize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY (VFX-P)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large plateau ringed with trees and underbrush. A single ROCK FACE juts upward, forming a backdrop for the plateau. Against the rock face, a large SCAFFOLDING has been erected -- planks and beams forming a complex structure -- ladders connect each level. It leads to a narrow ledge a dozen meters above. Picard MATERIALIZES on the plateau. (NOTE: Picard's combadge is gone and he is unarmed.) A moment as he looks around. strange animals and birds can be heard. He turns and sees Soran standing nearby, calmly looking at his pocket watch. Soran puts the watch away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran turns his back on Picard and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You must think I'm quite the madman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The thought had crossed my mind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The only possible reason you're here is because you're not entirely confident you can shoot down my probe after all. So you've come to dissuade me from my horrific plan. (beat) Good luck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 90A Picard takes a step to follow him and then is JOLTED backward by a large FORCEFIELD which briefly flashes into view. The field completely surrounds the plateau, enclosing Soran and the scaffolding, with Picard on the outside. OFF Picard's surprise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY- BRIDGE (VFX-P)                   91 The Klingon Navigator is working his console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lursa and B'Etor move to one of the consoles with a large monitor. The screen shows STATIC for a few seconds, then clears to a distorted view of a CEILING on the ENTERPRISE -- this is GEORDI'S POV. (NOTE: The POV is slightly fritzed, but free of the usual VISOR effects.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Crusher's face looms large in the picture, as if she's leaning over Geordi. She smiles and starts talking. We can see her lips move, but we can't hear what she's saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lursa and B'Etor pull back in surprise at the image.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have established the link.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put it through over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's working...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (silent) Don't worry, there's been no permanent damage. Your heart is perfectly fine. There's been a little arterial damage...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Human females are so repulsive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SICKBAY - CONTINUOUS                                   92 Beverly is leaning over La Forge, who is on a bio-bed. mid-conversation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... and some myocardial degeneration. I'm going to give you some hematozine, and I want to run more tests... but I think you're going to be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Doc.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY                                      93 Picard is walking the perimeter of the invisible forcefield, looking for some way in. Soran is concentrating on his PADD as Picard tries to engage him on some level.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't need to do this, Soran... I'm sure we could find another way to get you into this Nexus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 93A Soran gets up and works his control PADD. Suddenly a probe LAUNCHER DECLOAKS  in the middle of the plateau. The launcher is a cylindrical apparatus the size of a small car. Soran goes to the launcher, steps onto it and begins working the control panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This has touched a nerve in Soran... something dark and ugly flickers across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran looks up at Picard... and for a moment we can see that Picard has really gotten to him here... then he finally smiles a smile that doesn't quite reach his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calm, distracted) I've spent eighty years looking for another way, Captain. This is the only one. (beat) Of course, you could always come with me. You fancy yourself an explorer. Here's a chance to explore something no human has ever experienced.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if it means killing over two hundred million people. (beat, then with meaning) I wonder... did your wife Leandra know that she married a man who was capable of mass murder?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; pressing on) When you tucked your children into bed... do you suppose they ever suspected that their father would one day kill millions as casually as he kissed them goodnight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice try.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GEORDI'S BATHROOM - GEORDI'S POV                       94 Geordi is taking a bath. We can see his legs and feet sticking out of the water in front of him... he stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - BRIDGE (VFX-P)                  95 Lursa and B'Etor are still watching La Forge's POV on the monitor. They are bored and irritable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The POV shows Geordi's view as he stops in front of a mirror... wipes away the steam and reveals his own reflection. Lursa and B'Etor gnash their teeth in frustration...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought he was the Chief Engineer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then when is he going to Engineering?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY                                      96 Soran is working intently on the Launcher's Control Panel. Picard is still walking the perimeter of the Forcefield. he's also still trying to engage Soran, find some way to get to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran continues to work... keeps his voice calm and conversational.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran now turns and fixes Picard with a penetrating look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard freezes at this. Soran steps off the launcher with a confident look... he moves closer to where Picard is standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This strikes home with Picard's own recent concerns... he struggles for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran glances up at the sky expectantly, then turns away from Picard and goes back to work on the Launcher. OFF Picard's disturbed expression...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What you're about to do is no different from when the Borg destroyed your world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. And there was a time when I wouldn't have hurt anyone. Then the Borg came... and they showed me that if there is one constant in this universe, it's death. (beat) Afterwards, I began to realize that none of it mattered. We're all going to die anyway. It's only a question of how and when. You will too, Captain. You might contract a fatal disease... you might die in battle...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... or burn to death in a fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You looked surprised. But you shouldn't be. I've been to the Nexus, Captain. I know things about people. (beat) Aren't you beginning to feel time gaining on you? It's like a predator. It's stalking you. You can try to outrun it with doctors... medicines.new technologies... but in the end, time is going to hunt you down... and make the kill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're all. mortal, Soran. It's one of the truths of our existence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if I told you I found a new truth...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Nexus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Time has no meaning there. The predator has no teeth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - BRIDGE (VFX-P)                  97 B'Etor watching the monitor, impatient. The POV shows Geordi's view of walking down a CORRIDOR. Lursa walks over to join her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... he bathed... now he is roaming the ship. He must be the only Engineer in Starfleet who does not go to Engineering!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP- DAY (VFX-P)                               98 Picard continues to walk around the perimeter of the forcefield. He sees something on the ground -- a GNARLED ROOT from a large nearby tree. The root is poking out of the ground, leaving a small arch through which daylight can be seen. Picard's mind begins racing... he glances at Soran and then picks up a pebble and, while keeping his eye on the root, he tosses the pebble into the air, where it HITS the forcefield. -- The forcefield FLASHES on briefly and Picard can see that the bottom border of the field follows the contour of the root. But it does not extend underneath the arch. -- Soran turns at the sound of the crackling field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran returns to working on the Launcher. but Picard looks back down at the root... then walks away, planning his next move.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Careful, Captain. That's a fifty gigawatt forcefield. I wouldn't want to see you get hurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY- BRIDGE                          98A Lursa and B'Etor are watching the monitor of Geordi's POV with irritated expressions. On the monitor, Geordi rounds a corner and enters Engineering. The sisters lean forward eagerly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Finally!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENGINEERING                                            99 Geordi is talking to an engineer named FARRELL, N.D.s working in b.g. Mid-conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both move to consoles...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to run a Level Three diagnostic on the port plasma relays. I think one of the generators is fluctuating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, let's do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - BRIDGE (VFX-P)                 100 As before. On the screen, we can now see several of the monitors in Engineering. On the left side of the screen is the large cutaway view of the Enterprise. Lursa suddenly reacts to something on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B'Etor works. The image on their monitor RUNS BACKWARD for a moment and then FREEZES. On the screen, we can see several of the monitors in Engineering. On the left side of the screen is the large cutaway view of the Enterprise. Lursa touches the diagram.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B'Etor works. The picture ZOOMS IN on the cut-a-way graphic and SHARPENS in FOCUS. There are several blocks of numbers and text visible. Lursa studies the image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sisters exchange an excited glance, then move toward the command area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two sisters smile eagerly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's it! (to B'Etor) Replay from time index four-two- nine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Magnify this section and enhance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Their shields are operating on a modulation of two-five-seven point four...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls out) Adjust our torpedo frequency to match - two-five-seven point four!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     101 DATA (to Riker) Sir, I am detecting an anomalous subspace reading in Main Engineering. It may be -- WHAM! The ship is ROCKED HARD. Alarms go off on the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - ENTERPRISE AND KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)           102 The Klingon ship is FIRING FOUR T0RPEDOES at the Enterprise. The torpedoes PASS DIRECTLY THROUGH the ship's SHIELDS and hit directly on the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     103 WHAM! Another HIT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) They have found a way to penetrate our shields.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lock phasers and return fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE & KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)         104 The Enterprise FIRES at the Bird of Prey. but the phaser shots are stopped by the Klingon SHIELDS, which flash on when they're hit. The Bird of Prey returns FIRE. The shot carves a jagged tear in the Enterprise's hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                105 As before. The ship is jolted again... the Con console EXPLODES and the Con officer is killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi rushes to the Con and works...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Troi) Deanna, take the helm. Get us out of orbit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- THE ENTERPRISE & KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)          106 The Enterprise turns and leaves orbit, but the Klingon ship is right on top of them... FIRING at the defenseless starship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                107 A jolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another JOLT. The Bridge lights FLICKER. The situation is desperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship is JOLTED. They all hold on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hull breach on decks thirty-one Through thirty-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent, to Worf) Worf, that's an old Klingon ship. What do we know about it? Are there any weaknesses?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is a Class D-twelve Bird of Prey. They were retired from service because of defective plasma coils.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Plasma coils... is there any way we can use that to our advantage?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not see how. The plasma coil is part of their cloaking device...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENGINEERING                                          107A There is a sudden EXPLOSION on the upper level. Geordi and the other Engineers rush to deal with it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get a stabilizer on that conduit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                               107B Riker suddenly gets an inspiration as the Bridge is ROCKED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data goes to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf works.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Data) Could we access the defective coil and trigger their cloak?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (considers) Perhaps. (suddenly enthusiastic) Yes! If we sent a low-level ionic pulse, it might reset the coil and engage the cloaking systems.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (onto the idea) As their cloak begins to engage, their shields will drop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. And they'll be vulnerable for at least two seconds. (to Data) Data, lock onto that plasma coil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confident) No problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worf, prepare a spread of photon torpedoes. We'll have to hit them the instant they begin to cloak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're only going to get one shot at this. Target their primary reactor. With any luck, their warp core should implode.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE & KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)         108 The Enterprise ROLLS and TURNS back toward the planet, tries to get away from the Klingon ship. But the Bird of Prey follows its every move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                109 DATA I have accessed their coil frequency... initiating ionic pulse... The ship is hit again. An aft CONSOLE EXPLODES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make it quick!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY                                  110 Lursa and B'Etor in command... savoring their imminent victory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Navigator suddenly reacts to something on his console.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Navigator) Target their Bridge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Full disruptors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are cloaking!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mistress -- our shields are down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)                      111 The ship begins shimmering- engaging its cloak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     112 RIKER Fire! Worf works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KLINGON BIRD OF PREY (VFX-I)                          114 Lursa and B'Etor react to the sight on the Viewscreen as the spread of torpedoes heads directly for them. The two sisters exchange a look. The ship is suddenly ROCKED HARD and we can see the beginning of an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE KLINGON SHIP (VFX-I)                      115 The ship IMPLODES, completely destroyed. pieces of the shattered vessel float past the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     116 DATA (excited)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY (VFX-P)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard has made his way back to the gnarled root. He stands a few feet away... a couple of pebbles in his hand. He glances at Soran, who's absorbed with his work on the launcher. Picard then surreptitiously TOSSES a pebble toward the root. It misses and BOUNCES off the FORCEFIELD. Soran looks over his shoulder at Picard, who sits down on a rock. Soran returns to his work. Picard tosses a second pebble -- this one also hits the forcefield. Soran turns with a vaguely irritated look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard doesn't respond. Soran goes back to work. Picard waits a moment, then takes aim and TOSSES another pebble toward the root. This time, the pebble bounces underneath the arch and rolls onto the plateau - inside the forcefield. Picard keeps his expression neutral, but he's found a way in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as if to a child) Don't you have anything better to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENGINEERING                                           118 The room is a disaster. Wreckage from destroyed consoles and debris are scattered throughout the room. Geordi is desperately working with Engineers near the warp core, which is running faster and faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The warp core starts to spew white-hot GAS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The emergency isolation door comes DOWN and people start rushing out of Engineering. Geordi heads for the Corridor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to com) La Forge to Bridge. I've got a problem down here. The magnetic interlocks have been ruptured. I need to get the --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Coolant leak! Everybody out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the move, to com) Bridge, we've got a new problem. We're about five minutes from a Warp core breach. There's nothing I can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                119 Riker is faced with a no-win situation. He makes the decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi and Data work and Riker moves to the Captain's chair. He presses a button on the armchair console. a unique and urgent ALARM is heard throughout the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the ALARM SOUNDS:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Troi) Deanna, evacuate everyone into the saucer section. (to Data) Mister Data, prepare to separate the ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rushing through the corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: directing people toward the correct doorways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabbing their children and heading down the Corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They grab a wounded crewmember and pull him down the Corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scrambling through Jefferies Tubes and closing hatches behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP- DAY (VFX-P)                              121 Soran is finishing his work on the launcher. On one of the monitors on the control panel, we can now see alien graphics and numbers ticking by -- obviously a countdown in progress. Soran finishes and turns off the control panel. He steps down and looks over at Picard, who is standing near the forcefield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran turns and begins to climb up the scaffolding toward the top of the rock face. Picard watches him intently for a few moments... then quickly springs into action...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, if you'll excuse me, Captain, I have an appointment with eternity and I don't want to be late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . JEFFERIES TUBE                                        122 People scramble through the Tube and out into a Corridor. Geordi is the last man through the hatch. He turns and manually SHUTS the hatch behind him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hits combadge) That's it, Bridge -- we're all out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                123 DATA One minute to warp core breach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data works.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Data) Begin separation sequence. (to Troi) Full impulse power once we're clear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE (VFX-I)                        124
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from behind the REAR of the massive ship. A CRACK appears as the separation process begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE (VFX-I)                                       124A Everyone is watching the VIEWSCREEN with anticipation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Separation complete. Ten seconds to warp core breach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Engaging impulse engines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- SAUCER SECTION (VFX-I)                         129 Moves away from the battle section... before it can completely escape, the battle section EXPLODES -- the force of the explosion hits the saucer section, knocking it toward the planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE (VFX-I)                                        130 Everyone is knocked to their knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look at the Viewscreen... The planet is rushing toward them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Report.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helm controls are off-line!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he reacts to the terrifying image.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP- DAY (VFX-P)                              132 Picard has dropped to the ground and is on his back - he's trying to wriggle underneath the root. It's not easy. he knows there's not much room between the ground and the invisible field. he just gets his head and shoulders underneath when he accidentally TOUCHES the field and it CRACKLES violently around him --Picard is jolted by the shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 132A turns at the sound of the field, sees Picard, and then draws his weapon. Soran quickly fires at Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 132B is BLASTED APART, creating a cloud of dirt and smoke, obscuring Picard  and the whole area momentarily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran jumps down one level on the scaffolding, his disruptor still in his hand, ready just in case Picard somehow survived. Soran peers through the cloud of dust and debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dust from the explosion finally CLEARS... but Picard is gone along with several feet of the ground where he was crawling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 132C glances up at the sky and sees the distant ENERGY RIBBON just coming into view. There's no time to look for Picard. -- Soran begins to climb the scaffolding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- SAUCER SECTION (VFX-I)                         133
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the planet's atmosphere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                134 The ship is shaking and rolling VIOLENTLY. Everyone hanging on for dear life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teachers and parents lead a group of children toward an intersection. The parents go down one corridor, the teachers and children down another. One child cries out and tries to reach for its mother, but there's no time -- a teacher keeps the child moving down the hall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are bracing themselves for the crash, taking emergency positions against walls, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE (VFX-I)                                        137 The ground is getting closer on the viewscreen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (off console) I have rerouted auxiliary power to the lateral thrusters. I'm attempting to level our descent...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to com) All hands, brace for impact!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PLANET'S ATMOSPHERE - SAUCER SECTION (VFX-I)          138 The leading edge of the huge saucer TILTS UPWARD Slightly. and then it HITS the surface. the saucer begins to PLOW THROUGH the dense rain forest:  As the ship continues to tear through the jungle, we INTERCUT the following sequences.:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                               138A Riker and the others hanging on as the ship shakes violently..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A family huddles for protection as the WINDOWS are blown inward by debris...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . READY ROOM                                           138C The side window is BLOWN OUT... and Picard's photo album is tossed across the room along with everything else...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAUCER SECTION (VFX-I)                                138D Outside the ship, we see a huge WALL of metal CRASHING through the jungle, uprooting trees... dirt flying... birds scrambling out of the way... an enormous scene of destruction as it tears through the foliage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE                                                139 The ship continues to jump and shake... every light on the ship goes out in the crash. Finally, it comes to a STOP. There is a long, quiet beat... then people begin to stir in the darkened room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is slumped in his chair... he catches his breath, lifts his face and looks up into... SUNLIGHT. He shields his eyes and looks up at the ceiling and reacts...

direction.raw_text: . PLANET'S SURFACE - THE ENTERPRISE (WIDE SHOT)         142 (VFX-I) The saucer has come to a stop in the middle of a RAIN FOREST. The passage of the saucer has gouged a long trail through the forest behind the ship. Off this startling sight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY                                     143 Soran is climbing up the scaffolding. He gets a couple of levels up, and then suddenly a BOOT kicks him in the face. Picard has made it inside the field. A quick fight ensues, during which Picard is knocked a few levels down on the scaffolding. He LANDS hard -- happens to look up into the sky. He sees something.--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 144 The ENERGY RIBBON can be seen in the distant sky -- a bizarre snake of color streaking across the deep blue sky. Time is almost up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard avoids a vicious kick from Soran, glances down at the probe launcher, and realizes he's got one chance. He rolls to his feet, runs toward the probe launcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a THUNDEROUS ROAR as the launcher FIRES THE PROBE into the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plateau is suddenly quiet as the probe streaks toward the distant sun and disappears from view. Picard gets to his knees, stares after the probe, shocked. He's failed. -- They watch the sun for a silent moment, waiting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 146 begins to DARKEN and COLLAPSE, as seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the scene DARKENS as the sun goes out... and NIGHT FALLS on the planet. Soran, a look of profound elation on his face, makes his way to the top of the scaffolding and looks into the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 148 gets to his feet and stares at the onrushing Ribbon, the wind whipping up on the plateau. He backs away at the sight, coming to a stop with his back against the scaffolding. There's no where to run...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: RIBBON OF ENERGY TEARS ACROSS THE SCENE IN A TERRIFYING TORRENT OF LIGHT AND SOUND
THE SCENE IS WASHED OUT BY A BLINDING FLOOD OF RED LIGHT

direction.raw_text: 149 as the RIBBON OF ENERGY TEARS ACROSS THE SCENE IN A TERRIFYING TORRENT OF LIGHT AND SOUND. THE SCENE IS WASHED OUT BY A BLINDING FLOOD OF RED LIGHT... Then suddenly the Ribbon is GONE... and so are Picard and Soran. The plateau is strangely and utterly SILENT after the passage of the Ribbon... even the birds have stopped chirping in the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE- VERIDIAN III (VFX-I)                           150 As the ENERGY RIBBON rushes past the camera, a HUGE SHOCKWAVE from the destroyed star HITS the planet and it EXPLODES in a blast of fiery debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: being led through a darkened HALLWAY. He is wearing a blindfold. Off screen hands tug and pull at him, leading him forward down the hall. He's lost and confused, unsure where he is or what's going on. He tries to resist, but can't... the hands keep pulling at him... He is finally brought out into a larger room, dark. The hands release him and he stands alone. He takes a beat and tries to take control of the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hands reach into frame from off screen and remove the blindfold...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on? Where am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 152 The blindfold drops, revealing a blurry kaleidoscope of COLORS and SHAPES...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he blinks and tries to focus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 154 As the room comes into focus. The first thing we see is an enormous, gaily decorated CHRISTMAS TREE sparkling with hundreds of lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 24th-century FRENCH LIVING ROOM. It is beautifully decorated with lights, ornaments, holly. brightly wrapped presents are clustered beneath the Christmas tree. There are FIVE CHILDREN standing and sitting in the room, all looking at Picard with bright, smiling faces, waiting for him to say something. Picard stares at the scene for a moment, unsure how to react. Then we hear the woman's voice again, and we move to reveal an attractive WOMAN in her forties standing next to Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the children, a young GIRL, speaks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children break out into applause. The woman kisses him on the cheek, then steers him to a large, overstuffed chair. Picard sits down and the children starts handing out presents with much laughter and chatting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the activity swirls around him, Picard begins to feel an immense  sense of satisfaction and happiness. It's like a drug -- an overwhelming feeling of joy and contentment fills Picard. It's a wondrous experience. He settles back in the chair and a smile spreads across his face. For reasons he cannot name and does not even want to understand at the moment, he is very, very happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard answers as if it were the most natural thing in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of the children now crowd around the chair with a single large gift and hand it to Picard. One of the younger boys speaks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard tears open the box and pulls out a 19th century SEXTANT - an old-fashioned nautical navigational instrument. It's a beautiful piece with polished and gleaming brass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard eyes it with delight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children react with pleasure. They cluster around him, showering him with hugs and kisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard is covered in a blanket of love and affection. The children pull back and return to their own presents. There is a swirl of activity and commotion as a warm and heartfelt Christmas morning is played out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard nods as the woman EXITS the room. He looks around the scene, utterly happy, utterly content. The children continue to chatter and laugh among themselves as Picard's eye falls on the glorious Christmas tree. He can't help but smile as he looks over the ornaments and decorations...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go on... say something. They're waiting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... don't know what to say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say Merry Christmas, Papa!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a daze) Merry... Christmas...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one's for you... where's mine?... I hope this is the book I asked for... take this one to Papa...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Picard) Isn't the tree beautiful, Papa?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes... yes, it's astonishingly beautiful. All of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is from all of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you... I can't imagine what it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) It's a sack-tent!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean a sextant. And it's a handsome one at that... from about eighteen twenty, I'd say. Wherever did you find it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a secret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Oh, a secret... well, that makes it a doubly special gift. Thank you... thank you all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merry Christmas, Papa... I love You, Father... etc.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Picard) I'll go get dinner ready. they'll be starving in a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 156 of the sparkling lights and ornaments -- a swirl of color and light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eye is caught by something in particular on the tree. He leans forward slightly and stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 158 His eye has been caught by an ORNAMENT near the top of the tree. It is a large and beautiful glass ball with a tiny LIGHT at the center in the shape of a star. As Picard watches, the star suddenly GOES OUT... and it radiates a SHIMMERING LIGHT EFFECT that expands outward into the glass sphere. It's a startling and beautiful ornament whose effect is reminiscent of the star going out, as seen earlier in the movie. But this is just coincidence. this is the way the ornament was designed and it's simply one of many ornaments on the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reacts. The image of the ornament has touched a nerve within him somewhere. It has reminded him of something he'd nearly forgotten - a discordant note in an otherwise wondrous and magical scene. He frowns, the reverie momentarily disrupted. But he tries to push it aside, not wanting the spell to be broken. He stands and turns away from the tree and looks out a nearby window -- it's snowing and the beautiful image of snow soothes him for a moment. Then he reacts to something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 160 reflected on the pane of glass is the image of the ornament -- it's still blinking. Picard now realizes that this image is not going to go away... he can't hide from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard turns to see
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No... this isn't right... this can't be real...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's as real as you want it to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 161 standing before him. She is wearing the same outfit seen in the beginning of the movie on the Enterprise-B. As they talk, the children and the woman continue to move about their business as if Picard and Guinan aren't there. Picard is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard tries to make sense of it- he focuses on Guinan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guinan smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard glances over at the boy, who is building a play castle out of the 24th-century equivalent of "Lego". For a moment, Picard is tempted to drift back to the warm embrace of the fantasy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks around at the children... the lure to stay here becoming more powerful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a general rush toward the adjacent dining room. The youngest boy looks at Picard, goes over to him and takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks down into the face of his child. His heart swells, the temptation to stay here and live this out is profound. Almost in a trance, he takes a few steps with the child toward the dining room... His eye is caught again by the unusual ornament on the tree for a moment... torn between the two images. and then, in one of the most difficult moments of his life, he bends down to the child...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy looks at him quizzically for a moment, then obeys his father and dashes off toward the dining room to join the others. Picard straightens up and tries to steel his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard realizes the opportunity before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks crestfallen for a moment. Guinan gives him an enigmatic smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly there's the cry of a HAWK from offscreen. Picard turns at the sound -- 162   EXT. KIRK'S HOME - DAY                                     162 Picard finds himself standing outside a rustic, but Architecturally striking house with spectacular views in the Canadian Rockies. A hawk is circling overhead, making the crying sound that Picard heard. The air is cold, frigid -- Picard can see his breath. Picard is just starting to adjust to this sudden change in location when he hears the sound of wood being CHOPPED from around the corner of the house. Picard moves to look around the corner and sees - James T. Kirk. He's still in his uniform and looks exactly as he did the last time we saw him aboard the Enterprise-B at the beginning of the film. He is vigorously chopping wood with an axe. He's enjoying himself, lost in the sheer pleasure of the manual labor. He's never felt this good in his life. There's no trace of back pain or any other ailment. Picard recognizes the famous Captain - as would any 24 Century Starfleet officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk pauses, looks up at the strange man before him. His expression is wondrous, almost child-like. Like in Picard's Christmas sequence, Kirk is immersed in the sensual feeling of the Nexus. It's like a dream that's over-powered him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk points to a nearby log on the woodpile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes Picard a beat before he realizes that Kirk wants him to put the log on the chopping block for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard places the log on the block and Kirk gives it a vigorous chop with the axe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Kirk interrupts as he sees something o.c.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard follows his look to see SMOKE billowing out of one of the windows of the house. Kirk rushes into the house, and Picard follows...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan... what's going on? Where am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're in the Nexus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This... is the Nexus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For you. This is where you wanted to be...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I never had a wife, children, a home like this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enjoy them, Jean-Luc...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan, what are you doing here? I thought you were on the Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am on the Enterprise...I am also here. (off his puzzled look) Think of me as... an "echo" of the person you know... a part of her she left behind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Left behind...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When the Enterprise-B beamed us off the Lakul, we were partially in the Nexus. The transporters locked on to us... but somehow everyone left a part of themselves behind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Soran...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wherever he wanted to be...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to boy) In a few minutes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing, awed, to Guinan) These are my children... my children...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Yeah. They're great, aren't they? You can go back and see them born... go forward and see your grandchildren... time has no meaning here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dinner's ready! Let's go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Papa... are you coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on... go on without me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guinan... can I leave the Nexus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would you want to leave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (insistent) Can I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... where would you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, time has no meaning here. If you leave, you can go anywhere... any time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know exactly where I want to go... and when. Back to that mountaintop on Veridian Three... before Soran put out the star. I have to stop him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think things will be any different this time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. I'll need help. (beat) Guinan, will you come back with me? Together, we could -- GUINAN I can't leave. I'm already there, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know just the guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: James Kirk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beautiful day, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you mind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, do you realize what --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KIRK'S HOME- KITCHEN - DAY - CONTINUOUS               163 Kirk rushes in. The kitchen's decor is 19th century with a few 23rd Century touches -- copper pans and an antique stove mixed comfortably with computer consoles and Starfleet paraphernalia. Picard hesitates in the doorway -- a little unsure about rushing into some stranger's house. Kirk yanks a burning frying pan of food off the stove. It's very hot -- he quickly sets it down near the sink, waves the smoke away with his hand. KIRK Looks like someone was cooking eggs... (to Picard) Come on in, it's all right. This is my house -- or at least it used to be, I sold it years ago. Picard comes in and tries to orient Kirk to what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Kirk can react to this remark, an antique CLOCK on a shelf CHIMES as it strikes the hour. Kirk moves to the shelf and looks at the clock in surprise and wonder -- he is entranced by this experience, beginning to connect with things and memories from his past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk hears what Picard is saying, but like Picard in his fantasy, he is more interested in the sights and sounds around him. A dog barks from o.c. They both look as a large black dog bounds into the room and greets Kirk with enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk is still looking around the kitchen when suddenly we hear a WOMAN'S VOICE from somewhere upstairs that stops Kirk in his tracks. As she speaks, we can see the shock on Kirk's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk looks at the food on the stove. He's beginning to realize something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk glances at Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk moves to a drawer and opens it. Inside is a HORSESHOE with a tiny red bow tied to it. This confirms things for Kirk. He picks up the horseshoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk is swept up in the moment, overwhelmed by memories, sensations, feelings. He goes back to the frying pan and looks at the contents with a sudden burst of recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Kirk's mind is clearly elsewhere... he's being swept away by the emotion of the moment... realizing the opportunity he suddenly has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk indicates a shelf, as if asking Picard to go to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk moves to the stove and tosses out the ruined eggs. He cracks open two new eggs on the skillet and begins preparing a breakfast. Picard waits for a moment, then goes to the shelf, grabs the dill weed and hands it to Kirk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk takes the bottle and uses it to season the eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk moves to a cabinet and begins putting plates on a breakfast tray. Picard is getting a little impatient, but stirs the eggs anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk takes the pan of eggs back from Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Picard's words mean almost nothing to Kirk. He is Thoroughly enjoying himself and Picard is almost a distraction. Kirk begins serving the eggs onto the plates and grabs a small vase of flowers to put on the tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he remembers and turns to look at a nearby toaster -- as if on cue, two slices of toast pop out. Kirk grins and puts the toast on the plates. Kirk picks up the tray and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk goes out of the kitchen and Picard follows...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the starship Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This clock... I gave this clock to Bones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pressing on) I'm from what you would consider the future... the twenty-fourth century.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (affectionately) Jake! Jake, you miserable old Mutt... How can you be here? (to Picard) He's been dead seven years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is nine years ago... the day I told her I was going back to Starfleet...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know how real this must seem to you, but it's not. This isn't Really your house. We've both been caught up in some sort of temporal nexus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I was on the Enterprise-B... in the deflector control room... keep stirring these, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) The bulkhead in front of me Disappeared... then I was out there chopping wood. (back to stove) Thanks.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not exactly. As I said, this is some kind of...
dialogue.name: dialogue
