dialogue.raw_text: Captain, I need your help. I want you to leave the Nexus with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KIRK'S HOME - LIVING ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS          164 Kirk and Picard both on the move. Kirk heading for a staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk tries to keep it light, hoping this man will go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk brushes past Picard and stops at the foot of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk begins to climb the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes through a bedroom door and closes it behind him. Picard glances around the room in frustration, then gets a determined look on his face and marches up the stairs after Kirk, grasps the doorknob, opens it and steps through the door into
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have to go back to a planet called Veridian III and stop a man from destroying a star. There are millions of lives at stake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You said history considers me dead. Who am I to argue with history?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a Starfleet Officer and you have a duty to -- KIRK (hard) I don't need to be lectured by you. I was out saving the galaxy when your grandfather was still in diapers. And frankly, I think the galaxy owes me one (beat) I was like you once... so worried about duty and obligations that I couldn't see anything past this uniform. And in the end, what did it get me? Nothing. Not this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking up the stairs) I'm going to walk up these stairs, march into that bedroom and tell Antonia that I want to marry her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This time things are going to be different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARN - DAY - CONTINUOUS                               165 Picard suddenly finds himself standing in the doorway of a wooden barn. Straw on the floor... farm implements on the walls... sunlight streaming in through the slats. There are stalls in the barn with a few horses visible. Kirk is standing a short distance away -- he looks surprised as well... and he is no longer holding the tray of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk looks around for a moment, the pieces starting to fall into place. He smiles with a growing realization...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points to a horse with a saddle on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk moves to the barn door and opens it revealing a beautiful spring day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk grabs the horse, swings up onto the saddle, and rides out of the barn, filled with excitement. Picard watches him for a moment, then looks at one of the other horses in the barn. he makes a decision and then moves toward a saddle hanging on the wall...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (re: barn) This doesn't look like your bedroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no, it's not. It's better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Better?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is my uncle's barn in Iowa...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: horse) I took that horse out for a ride seven years ago... on a spring day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just like this. If I'm right, this is the day I met Antonia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This Nexus of yours is very clever. I can start all over again -- do things right from day one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE - DAY (VFX-P)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk is riding his horse hard over the countryside -- and across a stream... through a thicket of trees... and finally out onto a rolling plain. There is a large RAVINE up ahead. Kirk sees it and smiles tightly. He spurs his horse faster toward the ravine... The horse is tearing along... comes up to the edge of the precipice, and makes a daring leap to the other side. Horse and rider land together and Kirk spurs the horse on. But as he rides, we begin to see a change come over him -- a look of doubt crosses his face. Something's not right. He slows the horse to a trot... and then to a complete stop. He sits there for a moment and frowns. turns and looks back at the ravine, which is now a fair distance away. Something about that jump is nagging at him... He turns his horse around and then digs in his heels. The horse breaks into a gallop, racing back toward the ravine. Kirk grips the reins tight in his hands and then the horse makes the LEAP across yet again. This time when Kirk lands, he brings his horse to an immediate stop. We can see on his face that something is very wrong. He turns and stares at the ravine with a mixture of shock and sadness on his face. In the distance, Picard can be seen approaching on a horse of his own. He stops next to Kirk. There is a long, quiet moment as the two men sit there side by side. Kirk is introspective as he sorts through his feelings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quiet beat. Kirk turns and looks toward a particular hill in the distance, shading his eyes against the bright sun. Picard follows his gaze and we can now see the distant figure of a WOMAN walking her horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All euphoria is now gone from Kirk -- It's a moment of self-revelation. He glances around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk takes a beat, then looks at Picard. And in a way, he's truly seeing him for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a passion and a fervor in Kirk that we haven't seen until now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two captains face each other for a moment. Picard hears what Kirk is saying but also knows that's not the whole story. Picard gives him a direct look, and there is something in Picard's eyes -- a glint of resolve and determination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long, silent beat as Kirk considers Picard. And slowly, unexpectedly, a smile spreads across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And for the first time, we can see the twinkle in his eye that tells us Jim Kirk is back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men turn and walk away from Antonia.and as they walk, a ROAR OF COLOR AND SOUND WASHES OUT THE SCREEN, as seen before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (re: ravine) I must have made this jump fifty times. and every time it scared the hell out of me. But not this time. (beat) Because... it's not real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: woman) Antonia?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) She's not real either, is she? Nothing here is... nothing here matters...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's kinda like... orbital skydiving. Exciting for a few minutes... but in the end, you haven't really done anything... you haven't made a difference...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain of the Enterprise, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Close to retirement?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hadn't planned on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, let me tell you something - don't. Don't let them promote you... don't let them transfer you... don't let anything take you off the Bridge of that ship... (beat) Because while you're there, you can make a difference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't need to be on the Bridge of a starship. Come with me. Help me stop Soran. (beat) Make a difference again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can I argue with the Captain of the Enterprise? (a beat) What was the name of that Planet... Veridian III?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take it the odds are against us, and the situation is grim?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (musing) Of course, if Spock were here, he'd say I was being an irrational, illogical human for wanting to go on a mission like that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: ROAR OF COLOR AND SOUND WASHES OUT THE SCREEN,

dialogue.raw_text: Sounds like fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - DAY (VFX-P)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran is standing in front of the forcefield, facing Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We realize we are watching the same events play out again. Soran turns and begins to climb up the scaffolding toward the top of the rock face. Picard drops to the ground on his back and begins to wriggle underneath the forcefield. Picard accidentally TOUCHES the field...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, if you'll excuse me, Captain, I have an appointment with Eternity and I don't want to be late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 167A turns at the sound of the field, sees Picard, and then draws his weapon. Soran quickly FIRES at Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 167B is BLASTED APART, creating a cloud of dirt and debris, obscuring Picard and the whole area momentarily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran peers through the cloud of dust and debris.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Soran jumps down one level, his disruptor still in his hand, ready just in case Picard somehow survived.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The dust CLEARS... but Picard is gone along with several feet of the ground where he was crawling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 167C Soran glances up at the sky and sees the ENERGY RIBBON, then begins to climb the scaffolding. Suddenly a BOOT kicks him in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is attacking Soran in Picard's place. The two men begin to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 169 as Picard rushes to the probe launcher and steps up onto the control platform and desperately begins trying to shut down the launcher... The following happens very quickly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk fights with Soran, hand-to-hand, brutal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard works the control panel, trying to make sense of it all. It won't respond. The control panel is bizarre and confusing -- many different screens and alien graphics. The alien countdown graphics continues to race by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 169A the distant energy ribbon can be seen getting closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soran tries to pull his disruptor, but Kirk knocks it to the ground. There's a struggle for the weapon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard looks helplessly at the control panel. Nothing he does has any effect. He keeps hitting buttons...looking for other control panels, anything to affect the launcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 169C Suddenly, Picard touches one particular control and the screen CHANGES to an image of the Veridian SUN, held in the center of the alien CROSS-HAIR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 169D begins working the control panel... desperate... he looks at the screen... hits a control. Suddenly the probe CLOAKS. Picard reacts at his mistake. Picard is left standing on an invisible platform three feet in the air -- a bizarre sight. Picard isn't sure what to do -- he can feel the console, but he can't see any of the controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk punches Soran and sends him flying backward. Soran lands heavily on the ground, unconscious. Kirk stands over him, breathing heavily. He holds his back in pain -- that old back pain from the beginning of the movie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (desperate) Kirk -- there's a control PADD in his right pocket!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 169E sees Picard standing in mid-air and then reaches down, pulls the control PADD out of Soran's pocket. He begins working it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes open... he sees what Kirk is doing... looks around quickly... sees the disruptor lying a few feet away, just beyond his reach...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 171 Decloaks. Picard goes back to working on the controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 171A he smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without warning, Kirk is BLASTED forward, shot from behind. Reveal Soran on the ground with the disruptor in his hand. He gets up, whirls around, points the weapon at Picard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The twenty-fourth century isn't so tough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - WIDE                                         172 The probe is suddenly LAUNCHED in a roar of flame. Soran freezes. His eyes follow the probe as it arcs into the sky. The two men watch the probe as it heads toward the sun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 172A makes a sweeping turn to the right and arcs back down toward the planet. Soran watches in horror as the probe crashes harmlessly into the distant jungle. We hear a muffled explosion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 172B can't believe his dreams have been shattered. He looks into the sky and sees the distant ribbon streaking overhead. The disruptor falls from his hand as he rushes to the top of the scaffolding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves to Kirk, checks his pulse. The Captain's eyes flutter -- he's still holding on, but he's badly wounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 174 is standing on the rock ledge. He reaches up toward the sky as if trying to grab the Ribbon with his bare hands...but the ribbon passes by and disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His look of shock turns to fury and madness. He turns to Picard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 174B He jumps down a few levels and then DIVES off the scaffolding at Picard. But Picard is quicker. He GRABS the disruptor and FIRES -- the BLAST CATCHES SORAN IN MID-AIR . Soran drops to the ground a short distance away. Dead. The pocket watch has been shattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns back to Kirk, cradles the dying man's head in his lap. Kirk's eyes flick open, and he takes a ragged breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk coughs. His eyes flutter. He's fading fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk coughs again
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk looks up at the sky. the sunlight is warm on his face. A quiet moment... then, with a last smile on his face
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk dies. Hold te scene for a long moment, the two men in the quiet clearing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll find a way to contact the Enterprise. You're going to be all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did we do it? Did we make a Difference...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (beat) Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Least I could do...for a Captain of the Enterprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try to hang on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - SUNSET                                  176 Close on Picard's hand as he places a stone on a large pile of other stones. MOVE TO REVEAL that Picard is placing the final few rocks on Kirk's grave. He reaches into a pocket and pulls out Kirk's command insignia pin. He carefully places it on the grave... and stands there silently for a few moments. A distant WHINE of engines can be heard. Picard looks up into the sky...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 177 An Enterprise SHUTTLECRAFT is flying through the sky toward the mountaintop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAINTOP - SUNSET                                  178 The shuttle has just landed, and the door OPENS as Picard enters the clearing. Worf, Geordi and N.D. security guards jump out to meet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard moves toward the shuttle... then stops as he notices that the shuttle is damaged. Picard turns and notices for the first time that La Forge has a bandage on his face and Worf's uniform is torn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf and La Forge exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about Doctor Soran?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You needn't worry about the Doctor anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was there a problem with the Klingons?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could say that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PLANET SURFACE - THE ENTERPRISE (WIDE SHOT) (VFX-I)   179 as seen before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain's log, stardate 48650.1. The starship Farragut has arrived in orbit and has begun to beam up the Enterprise survivors for transport back to Earth. CUT TO:
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE - CORRIDOR - DAY                           180 A hive of activity -- Crewmembers moving about, carrying personal effects, equipment, etc. Some wounded people being carried on stretchers... The corridor is lit by emergency beacons and a HATCH has been opened at one end of the Corridor leading to the exterior of the ship. Daylight and jungle can be seen outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Corridor in find Beverly helping an Injured crewmember into the arms of a waiting Medical N.D. Ogawa walks up to her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beverly nods. She looks exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two medical N.D.s walk past, carrying an empty stretcher. Beverly glances at them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (continuing) Our casualties were light. but unfortunately the Enterprise herself cannot be salvaged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That should be the last of the wounded, Doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two hundred thirty-two patients in under two days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calls out) Save that stretcher...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there another patient?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- that one's for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER LOCATION                                      181 Data and Troi are looking through rubble in a different section of the ship with tricorders. Troi reacts to something on the tricorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data moves to her, with a hopeful and excited look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data hands his tricorder to Troi and then begins to pull debris aside with android strength.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Over here, Data! I think I've found something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off tricorder) One life sign, very faint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Data pulls aside a large piece of plating, revealing Spot the Cat sitting in the wreckage. She looks at Data and gives a plaintive meow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up the cat and holds it close, stroking its fur. The cat purrs happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data turns, revealing that there are tears in his eyes. Troi is surprised and touched at the sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troi puts a gentle hand on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data looks up at her and smiles through his tears. OFF the image of Data cuddling his cat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (relieved) Spot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am very happy to find you, Spot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Another family reunited.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data... are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am not sure, Counselor. I am happy to see Spot... and yet I am crying. My emotional program must be malfunctioning again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Data... I think it's working perfectly.
dialogue.name: dialogue
